member.name: P:Vortice.XAudio2.Fx.VolumeMeterLevels.PeakLevels
member.summary: Array that will be filled with the maximum absolute level for each channel during a processing pass. The array must be at least ChannelCount × sizeof(float) bytes. may be null if is not null.

member.name: P:Vortice.XAudio2.Fx.VolumeMeterLevels.RMSLevels
member.summary: Array that will be filled with root mean square level for each channel during a processing pass. The array must be at least ChannelCount × sizeof(float) bytes. may be null if is not null.

member.summary: Occurs when the voice has just finished playing a contiguous audio stream.

member.summary: Gets or Sets the overall volume level for the voice.

member.summary: Sets the overall volume level for the voice.
member.param: Overall volume level to use.

member.name: M:Vortice.XAudio2.IXAudio2Voice.SetChannelVolumes(System.Int32,System.Single[])
member.summary: Sets the volume levels for the voice, per channel.
member.param: Number of channels in the voice.
Array containing the new volumes of each channel in the voice. The array must have Channels elements.

member.name: M:Vortice.XAudio2.IXAudio2Voice.SetEffectChain(Vortice.XAudio2.EffectDescriptor[])
member.summary: Replaces the effect chain of the voice.
member.param: An array of that describes the new effect chain to use. If null is passed, the current effect chain is removed. If array is non null, its length must be at least of 1.

member.name: M:Vortice.XAudio2.IXAudio2Voice.SetOutputVoices(Vortice.XAudio2.VoiceSendDescriptor[])
member.summary: Designates a new set of submix or mastering voices to receive the output of the voice.
member.param: Array of structure pointers to destination voices. If outputVoices is null, the voice will send its output to the current mastering voice. To set the voice to not send its output anywhere set an array of length 0. All of the voices in a send list must have the same input sample rate, see {{XAudio2 Sample Rate Conversions}} for additional information.

member.name: M:Vortice.XAudio2.IXAudio2Voice.SetOutputMatrix(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single[])
member.summary: Sets the volume level of each channel of the final output for the voice. These channels are mapped to the input channels of a specified destination voice.
member.param: Confirms the output channel count of the voice. This is the number of channels that are produced by the last effect in the chain.
Confirms the input channel count of the destination voice.

Array of [sourceChannels x destinationChannels] volume levels sent to the destination voice. The level sent from source channel S to destination channel D is specified in the form levelMatrix[sourceChannels x D + S]. For example, when rendering two-channel stereo input into 5.1 output that is weighted toward the front channels-but is absent from the center and low-frequency channels-the matrix might have the values shown in the following table.

member.name: M:Vortice.XAudio2.IXAudio2Voice.SetOutputMatrix(Vortice.XAudio2.IXAudio2Voice,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single[])
member.summary: Sets the volume level of each channel of the final output for the voice. These channels are mapped to the input channels of a specified destination voice.
member.param: A destination of for which to set volume levels. Note If the voice sends to a single target voice then specifying null will cause SetOutputMatrix to operate on that target voice.
Confirms the output channel count of the voice. This is the number of channels that are produced by the last effect in the chain.
Confirms the input channel count of the destination voice.

Array of [sourceChannels x destinationChannels] volume levels sent to the destination voice. The level sent from source channel S to destination channel D is specified in the form levelMatrix[sourceChannels x D + S]. For example, when rendering two-channel stereo input into 5.1 output that is weighted toward the front channels-but is absent from the center and low-frequency channels-the matrix might have the values shown in the following table.

member.name: M:Vortice.XAudio2.IXAudio2Voice.SetOutputMatrix(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the volume level of each channel of the final output for the voice. These channels are mapped to the input channels of a specified destination voice.
member.param: Confirms the output channel count of the voice. This is the number of channels that are produced by the last effect in the chain.
Confirms the input channel count of the destination voice.

Array of [sourceChannels x destinationChannels] volume levels sent to the destination voice. The level sent from source channel S to destination channel D is specified in the form levelMatrix[sourceChannels x D + S]. For example, when rendering two-channel stereo input into 5.1 output that is weighted toward the front channels-but is absent from the center and low-frequency channels-the matrix might have the values shown in the following table.
Identifies this call as part of a deferred batch. See the {{XAudio2 Operation Sets}} overview for more information.
